block.name: search_rows_sql
block.title: Select rows using custom SQL
block.description: Select rows using custom SQL in Oracle

input.sql:
--  Code developer by SIPAWAR
-- Reference code: "XXRH_ERP_VRM_PKG"
 Select aps.creation_date,
             aps.last_update_date,
             aps.vendor_name,
             aps.segment1,
             aps.vendor_type_lookup_code,
             aps.vat_registration_num,
             CASE
               WHEN end_date_active IS NULL THEN
                'Yes'
               WHEN (end_date_active IS NOT NULL AND
                    end_date_active > SYSDATE) THEN
                'Yes'
               ELSE
                'No'
             END Supplier_Active, 
             aps.attribute1,
             aps.attribute2,
             aps.attribute3,
             aps.attribute9,
             aps.attribute10,
             aps.attribute4,
             aps.attribute5,
             aps.attribute6,
             aps.attribute7,
             aps.attribute8,
             aps.vendor_id,
             apss.address_line1, 
             apss.city,
             apss.state, 
             apss.zip, 
             apss.country 
        FROM apps.ap_suppliers          aps, 
             apps.ap_supplier_sites_all apss 
       WHERE 1 = 1
         AND aps.vendor_id = apss.vendor_id
         AND (apss.inactive_date is null or apss.inactive_date > sysdate)
         AND apss.vendor_site_id =
             (SELECT vendor_site_id
                FROM apps.ap_supplier_sites_all
               WHERE vendor_id = aps.vendor_id
                 AND (inactive_date is null or inactive_date > sysdate)
                 AND ROWNUM = 1) 
         AND (aps.vendor_type_lookup_code NOT IN
             ('EMPLOYEE', 'EMPLOYEE REIMBURSEMENT', 'CANDIDATE') OR
             aps.vendor_type_lookup_code is null)
         AND TRUNC(aps.last_update_date) >= TRUNC(sysdate - :p_days)
